summary:
8. The Council stresses the importance of achievable targets, and requests the Secretary-General to report every 90 days on progress towards implementing UNAMID's mandate.

9. The Council demands all parties end violence, attacks on civilians, peacekeepers, and humanitarian personnel, and comply with human rights and international humanitarian law.

10. The Council expresses concern at the humanitarian situation, calls for full implementation of the Communiqu√© on Facilitation of Humanitarian Activities in Darfur.

11. The Council reiterates that there can be no military solution to the conflict in Darfur and that an inclusive political settlement and UNAMID's deployment are essential.

12. The Council demands all parties engage fully and constructively in the peace process without preconditions.

13. The Council notes that conflict in one area of Sudan affects other areas and urges UNAMID to coordinate with other UN missions.

14. The Council requests UNAMID to assist and complement UNMIS' efforts in preparing for referenda in Southern Sudan and Abyei.

15. The Council stresses the importance of achieving dignified and durable solutions for refugees and internally displaced persons.
Here is a concise summary of the document:

The Security Council:

16. Notes that security will facilitate early recovery in Darfur, stresses the importance of early recovery efforts, and encourages UNAMID to facilitate the work of the UN Country Team and expert agencies on early recovery and reconstruction.

17. Expresses concern over localized conflicts, violence, and proliferation of arms in Darfur, and requests UNAMID to support local conflict resolution mechanisms and monitor arms.

18. Demands parties to the conflict protect civilians from sexual violence, and requests UNAMID to report on its strategy to protect women and children from sexual and gender-based violence.

19. Requests the Secretary-General to monitor and report on the situation of children and dialogue with parties to end recruitment and use of child soldiers.

20. Requests the Secretary-General to review and update UNAMID's concept of operations and rules of engagement.

21. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
